page.title: 09Housing in Exbourne area.
page.content: Most of the village is very old.The houses are made of cob or stone.Quite a few are thatched,most are slated. There are a few Council houses and old peoples bungalows.What was the Manor garden is now a new estate of Executive type houses,too expensive for the locals to buy.There are also a few individual plots for private house building.There are 3 farms in the village,2 are Saxon in origin,and cob. 4 are red brick Victorian buildings,1 of these is the Post Office. In Honeychuch there are three farms. One is cob.One is stone. One is Georgian.We think this is cob and stone,the outside is smooth rendered. Other farms in the area are cob if mediaeval;stone if later and brick if recently built.
